member.name: T:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Asset.Asset
member.summary: Class that represent an asset. An asset is normally a device used in testing that can be controlled for service maintenance, running count etc.

member.summary: Fetches a specific asset.

member.summary: Sets, updates or remove an asset's parent.

New parent serialNumber for the asset (can be null).
member.returns: AssetResponse object (with the asset's parent serial number set)

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Asset.AssetHandler.IncrementAssetUsageCount(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Increment an asset's usage count by default (1) or specified int value.
member.param: Boolean with default=false. Set to true if you want to increment the asset's sub-assets.

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Asset.AssetHandler.GetAssets(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches all assets, filtered by a specified OData (REST) filter.
member.param: OData filter (syntax example: ($"startswith(serialNumber,'{Prefix}')"). NB! Uses camel casing.
member.returns: AssetResponse object with filtered assets in SubAssets property

member.summary: Fetches all assets, filtered by tag.

member.summary: Fetches all sub assets of a parent asset.

member.summary: Fetches sub assets of a parent asset down to and including level.
member.param: How many sub assets of sub assets to get. 0 to get all, 1 to get direct children only.

member.name: T:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler
member.summary: Interface to handle serialnumbers from WATS MES. Written by Ragnar Engnes, Virinco as - 2016
member.remarks: Some methods need a special access token to use, called token (not to be confused with tokenID, which is WATS token). That access token is '1C3CFC7C-1386-4219-94F4-06D2B7FD8E18'.

member.name: T:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.Status
member.summary: Serialnumber type status

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.Status.Ready
member.summary: Local store ready for retrieval

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.Status.NotInitialized
member.summary: Not ready for retrieval, run Setup first>

member.name: T:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.RequestType
member.summary: Describes how the client retrieves serial numbers from server

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.RequestType.Reserve
member.summary: Work in offline mode, local pool of serial numbers. Pool is reserved at server

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.RequestType.Take
member.summary: Work in online mode, serialnumbers retrieved are Taken at once

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, creates an object reference
member.param: Type of serial number, e.g. MACAddress

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.FormatAsMAC(System.Int64,System.Char)
member.summary: Converts from Int to MAC string

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.GenerateAndUploadSerialNumbers(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Char,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Guid)
member.summary: Generates and uploads serialnumbers to server. can be used to convert a MAC string
member.returns: A list of serialnumbers that already existed

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.UploadSerialNumbersFromFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Guid)
member.summary: Uploads a text file with serialnumbers to the server, one sn per line - separated by CR/LF

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.Initialize(System.String,System.String,Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.RequestType,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Initialize a client and make it ready for serial number retrieval.
member.param:
Legal Values :
Take: Client must be online and requested number of serialnumbers will be marked as Taken in the SN database
Reserve: Client downloads a number of serialnumbers and makes a reservation in the SN database.
The downloaded serial numbers are stored and maintained in an XML file on the client (C:\ProgramData\Virinco\WATS\AddressStore)
When there are serialnumbers left in the local store, new serialnumbers are downloaded from server
If set to true, requested serialnumbers will be contiguous (NB: Only MAC addresses)
How many serialnumbers that are reserved on the server (When requestType=Resvere)
Number of remaining offline serialnumbers before server is polled for a new batch
If specified, will restrict serial numbers retrieved to be greater or equal this value
Deprecated. Used to be that serial numbers would be registered to the site with this name.
Deprecated. Used to be a special Guid needed to perform this function.

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.SetReuseOnDuplicateRequest(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the behaviour of the serialnumber handler to re-use serialnumbers if referencedSN and referencedPN and number requested has been requested earlier (in the same call)
member.param: Turns on this functionality (default is off)

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.CancelReservations(System.Guid)
member.summary: Cancels any reservations that is not taken from the local store on the server.
member.param: Deprecated. Used to be a special Guid needed to perform this function

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.GetStatus
member.summary: Returns the status of a SerialnumberType

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.GetFreeLocalSerialNumbers
member.summary: Returns the number of local serial numbers that are not taken.

member.summary: Returns information about the current pool when type is Reserve

member.summary: Returns information about the current pool when type is Reserve

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.GetSerialNumber(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns one serial number, see also
member.param: Associate this serial number to this serialnumber
Associate this serial number to this partnumber

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Production.SerialNumberHandler.GetTakenSerialNumbers(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns serial numbers already taken.
member.param: Search for serial numbers associated with this serial number, or null to only search by reference part number.
Search for part numbers associated with this serial number, or null to only search by reference serial number.
member.returns: Serial numbers as array of strings

member.summary: Converts MAC string to int

member.summary: Cancels all reservations for all types. Useful before disconnecting the client to ensure all unused reserved serial numbers are freed.

member.summary: Text is not modified.

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.EllipsisFormat.End
member.summary: Text is trimmed at the end of the string. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.summary: Text is trimmed at the begining of the string. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.EllipsisFormat.Middle
member.summary: Text is trimmed in the middle of the string. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.EllipsisFormat.Path
member.summary: Preserve as much as possible of the drive and filename information. Must be combined with alignment information.

member.name: F:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.EllipsisFormat.Word
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a word boundary. Must be combined with alignment information.

member.summary: String used as a place holder for trimmed text.

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.Software.SetRootFolderPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set path to local software root folder, where packages will be installed.

param.name: rootFolderPath
param.para: Path to the new folder packages will be installed into. Must be an absolute path, and should be an empty folder.
NB! Existing files in the folder may be overwritten by packages.

param.name: moveExistingPackages
param.para: Choose to move packages files to the new folder. May fail if folder or file with same name as a package already exists in the new folder. If files are not moved, installed packages will stop working until they are reinstalled.
NB! If the current root folder does not only contain packages, those files will also be moved.

member.name: M:Virinco.WATS.Interface.MES.Software.Software.GetRootFolderPath
member.summary: Returns the local Root Folder path where software packages are installed
